meanings.definition: A person or thing that blemishes or tarnishes.
meanings.sent1: The clumsy painter was a blemisher on the wall, leaving splatters everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The spilled ink was a blemisher on the clean paper.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat became a blemisher when it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: His dishonesty was a blemisher on his otherwise impeccable reputation.
meanings.sent5: The scratch on the car was a noticeable blemisher on its shiny surface.

meanings.definition: To mar or spoil the perfection or beauty of something.
meanings.sent1: Please be careful not to blemisher the delicate artwork with your fingerprints.
meanings.sent2: The rain threatened to blemisher the freshly painted fence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to blemisher the picnic by stealing all the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: Her harsh words seemed to blemisher the joyful atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the monument blemished its historical significance.

meanings.definition: To make a mark or flaw on something.
meanings.sent1: Accidentally dropping the glass blemisher the table with a crack.
meanings.sent2: The careless child blemisher the new book with crayon scribbles.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy blemisher the carpet with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds blemisher the roof of the house with missing shingles.
meanings.sent5: The artist's signature blemisher the painting, adding a personal touch.
